column4: hi guys! i have a debian 6 dom0 and a ubuntu 11.10 domU. I want to install the Xen based kernel in the domU so I can use pygrub
I don't see a linux-image-*xen package I'm used to seeing.. what am i missing? A repo?
why?
it's an ubuntu guest
debian has nothing to do with this
other hten its virtualizing the ubuntu VM i'm wokring on
it's an ubuntu 'machine' i'm woring on and i need the xen kernel package
for it
but i need the one in ubuntu 11.10..
that does't look like a kernel
I was just after a description
ahh okies
sorry
Seems to me I may be SOL
no amount of googling or repo searching is helping me
!info xen-utils-common
!info xen-utils-4.1
| https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Xen
unless the kernel is built in maybe
might be ubuntu is more geared to KVM
even still, it should be bootable to xen
